WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING
RIESGOS (INTERNAL VALIDATION TEAM) está buscando un/a PRICING DATA ANALYTICS & MODELS ANALYST para nuestras oficinas en BOADILLA DEL MONTE (HEADQUARTERS)
POR QUÉ DEBERÍAS CONSIDERAR ESTA OPORTUNIDAD
En Santander ( www.santander.com ) somos actores principales en la transformación del sector financiero. ¿Quieres unirte a nuestro equipo?
Riesgo de crédito, Riesgo de tipos de interés, Riesgo de liquidez, Riesgo operacional, Riesgo reputacional... Hay mucho tipos de riesgos, por ello su análisis y quantificación es clave para nuestro propósito de ser un banco, Simple, Personal y Justo.
Trabajar en riesgos significa hacerlo desde una perspectiva de gestión que contribuya al progreso sostenible de las personas y las empresas. Adoptamos una sólida cultura de riesgos y esperamos que todos nuestros profesionales, independientemente del puesto que ocupen, tengan una actitud proactiva y responsable hacia la gestión de riesgos.
Santander se enorgullece de ser una organización donde hay igualdad de oportunidades, independientemente de raza, sexo, religión, edad, orientación sexual, estado civil discapacidad, nacionalidad o identidad de género.
QUÉ HARÁS EN TU TRABAJO
Como Pricing Data Analytics & Models Analyst tu objetivo será realizar revisiones (validaciones) independientes de los modelos que se usan en el Banco para la valoración de derivados incluyendo, además de los propios modelos de valoración, los modelos involucrados en la construcción de inputs de mercado, modelos de ajusta de valoración (VA) y modelos de sensibilidades.
Necesitamos a alguien como tú para que nos ayude en distintos ámbitos:
Llevar a cabo análisis críticos e informados para entender los modelos: sus hipótesis y su impacto en las principales métricas de valoración y sensibilidades.
Desarrollar modelos independientes y diseñar pruebas de adecuación de las hipótesis teóricas subyacentes, con el fin de establecer un cuestionamiento efectivo de los modelos que el banco utiliza en producción.
Evaluar la implementación de los modelos validados en los sistemas de producción.
Ser capaz de formarse una opinión independiente sobre la idoneidad de los modelos validados para el uso al que se destinan, y de comunicarla de forma efectiva a diferentes partes interesadas, tanto internas como externas.
Producir documentación de calidad que refleje los análisis realizados a los modelos validados.
Establecer y fomentar una relación continua y fluida con los diferentes intervinientes en la gestión del Riesgo de Modelo: Trading, Quants de Front Office, Riesgos de Mercado, Metodología, etc
EXPERIENCIA
No es necesaria experiencia previa al tratarse de un puesto junior, aunque se valorará en caso de aportarla el candidato.
EDUCACIÓN
Matemáticas, Física, Ingeniería o Titulación con alto componente matemático/cuantitativo.
Se valorarán estudios de doctorado y/o formación complementaria tipo Máster en Gestión de Riesgos, Finanzas Cuantitativas o Data Science.
HABILIDADES & CONOCIMIENTOS
Competencia plena demostrable en matemáticas (cálculo diferencial e integral, análisis numérico, deseable teoría de EDOs, EDPs y/o cálculo estocástico).
Conocimiento de lenguajes de programación (Python, Matlab, C/C++).
Deseable conocimiento de sistemas de control de versiones (Git o similares).
Deseable conocimiento de entorno de documentación LaTeX.

What are we looking for?
About you
We are looking for a talented Analyst Data Scientist to join the Analysis & Monitoring team. Our ideal candidate should be enthusiastic about quality assessment of models, trading algorithms and quantitative strategies, as well as building strong relationships with our business stakeholders to provide them with the best support on their functional questions.
The successful candidate will have the opportunity to oversight all the productive models, algos and strategies from Advanced Analytics & Algorithmic Trading, working in the following areas:
Design, implementation and monitoring of quality controls for advanced analytics models, trading algorithms and quantitative investment strategies. These controls ensure that the performance of models and algos does not deteriorate after their release to production.
Data analysis of the behavior of productive models, algos and strategies. These implementations generate a large amount of data that requires Data Science tools to understand it and explain it to the business.
Rigorous evaluation of financial impact and KPIs of productive models, algos and strategies. For instance, by analyzing A/B testing results.
Challenge Data Scientists from the product teams before releasing models or algos into production, by doing a peer review of their proposal
Engage with the Advanced Analytics Discipline in implementing best practices regarding model monitoring.
Provide functional support to the business units (traders and sales) regarding data analytics, models, trading algorithms or quantitative strategies.
The ideal candidate will have:
A master degree in physics, mathematics, statistics, engineering or computer science.
1 - 3 years of experience in a technical or data science role in a business environment. Previous experience in the financial markets and / or previous experience in advanced analytics models validation and monitoring is highly valuable.
Outstanding mathematical literacy: you should be able to discuss business problems using mathematical terms on a piece of paper.
Programming skills in languages like Python or Scala.
Practical knowledge of standard statistics and machine learning libraries, and big data frameworks like Hadoop and Spark
Good English level. Spanish is valuable but optional: we welcome international applications
The ability to work under pressure. The team is fully integrated into business units. You will have the opportunity to generate high impact with your work, but a strong commitment to delivery is a must have.
Overview
Overview
Advanced Analytics & Algorithmic Trading is the team of Data Scientists in C&IB Global Markets that implement trading algorithms, quantitative investment strategies and advanced analytics models for trading and sales teams. We have a strong focus on analyzing and monitoring the quality of all our implementations and providing first class support to our business stakeholders. That is the reason why we have a specialized team, Analysis & Monitoring, that handles these critical tasks.


About the job
To give you an idea, a few examples of topics you would be looking at are:
From Concept Drift to Model Degradation: An Overview on Performance-Aware Drift Detectors, by F. Bayram, B.S. Ahmed, and A. Kassler: arxiv.org/pdf/2203.11070.pdf
Machine Learning in Non-Stationary Environments: Introduction to Covariate Shift Adaptation, by Sugiyama M. and Kawanabe M.
Advances in Financial Machine Learning, by Marcos López de Prado.
The Science of Algorithmic Trading and Portfolio Management, by Kissell, R.
How can you expect that a typical day unfolds if you join the team?
You will start the day checking that our trading algorithms, models and quantitative strategies, as well as the supporting analytics processes, have a smooth start.
Later, you will join the rest of the data scientists to discuss their different lines of work
and share ideas.
Sitting on the open trading floor, or working from home (we operate in a flexible 60% office, 40% home scheme), you will have extensive time to engage with our business stakeholders on functional questions; discuss with product data scientists potential quality issues in their implementations; improve and implement new data science based monitoring processes that evaluate the potential degradation of algos, models and strategies; analyze financial impact and KPIs; participate in workflows of approval of new implementations by challenging the product data scientists proposals from a functional point of view; and investigate potential alerts regarding the performance of algos, models and strategies.
Some time might be also allocated for learning and training, either at campus BBVA or with the rest of the team in our journal and book club sessions, where we discuss in group the latest books and papers relevant to our activity.

At BBVA, we are ahead of the transformation that is taking place in the banking sector, challenging the status quo, to make life easier to our customers.
